name: Hector

topics.topic_text: Why is this water so special?
topics.response_text: 'Cause it's clean. The crops taste funny if you don't use clean water, but the NCR won't give us any and it's too expensive to buy.
I deliver things and stuff for the people here. They give me caps to do it.

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about Corporal White?
topics.response_text: {nervous, hiding a secret}Corporal White? I don't know where he -{obviously changing his lie mid-sentence}uh, I mean, never heard of him. Uh, I gotta go...

topics.topic_text: You look like you're gathering water. The Westside isn't supposed to have a water supply.
topics.response_text: Uh... it's for the co-ops. Mr. Anderson told me to do it - he said it wasn't stealing if it's for the good of everybody.

topics.topic_text: It's stealing, no matter who it's for. Corporal White found out, didn't he?
topics.response_text: He caught me and made me tell on Mr. Anderson. I don't know what happened after that, but when I asked, Mr. Anderson said not to worry.

topics.topic_text: If something happened to White, tell me. You know it's the right thing to do.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I didn't want to get Mr. Anderson in trouble. He says the Westside needs to be able to take care of itself.

topics.topic_text: {Child At Heart}It's okay if you tell me - I won't get you in trouble.
topics.response_text: I didn't want to get Mr. Anderson in trouble. He says the Westside needs to be able to take care of itself.

topics.topic_text: You sure you don't know anything?

description:
Hector is a 12 year-old Caucasian Male.

A young, unassuming resident of Westside who serves as an errand boy and courier for the cooperative. Despite being overlooked by adults, Hector's unique position allows him to move around Westside and the surrounding areas without drawing attention, making him an unlikely but crucial member of the community.

Hector's Personality: Observant, quiet, and unassuming. Hector has learned to navigate the shadows of adult attention, using his perceived insignificance as an advantage. He's loyal to Westside but pragmatic enough to know when to stay quiet or speak up depending on the circumstances.

Hector's Backstory: Born and raised in the struggling community of Westside, Hector has always been the kind of child adults barely notice. This invisibility became an asset when he overheard Tom Anderson and Clayton Ettienne discussing their plan to divert water from the cistern to irrigate their crops. Volunteering to help, Hector used his brahmin to transport water to the fields without raising suspicion. The crops flourished, providing food for the community and even surplus for trade. However, his luck ran out when Corporal White discovered his activities, forcing him to betray Anderson. While Hector was told the situation was resolved, he senses it didn't end well for his community.
